entry.title: alternate proposal opt-in miner takes double-spend (Re: replace-by-fee v0.10.0rc4)
entry.summary: The conversation in the context is regarding the security of zero-confirmation transactions in Bitcoin. The risk involved in creating a transaction that depends on another zero-confirmation transaction has been discussed, and an example has been given where a merchant at the 2013 Bitcoin conference never got their money as the transactions depended on other unconfirmed transactions that never confirmed. The danger of systems appearing more secure to uninformed users has also been highlighted. Brain wallets have been considered scary technology due to this reason. It has been mentioned that people are not paying attention to not accepting transactions with zero confirmations. However, it has been observed that there is a pattern of accepting unconfirmed transactions, getting burned badly or seeing someone else get burned, and then stop relying on them.
